newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-AGL says Q1 sales up two pct.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-AGL says Q1 sales up two pct.

text.p: The Australian Gas Light Co (AGL) managing director Len Bleasel said on Tuesday the group posted a sales rise of two percent in the three months to September 30 compared with a year earlier.

"Sales are up about two percent," Bleasel told reporters after the company annual meeting in reply to a question on first quarter sales. Bleasel would not give a sales figure. AGL reported sales of A$886.1 million in the 1995/96 year.
AGL outgoing chairman Richard Mason told shareholders at the meeting that AGL was trading to budget in the first quarter.
Bleasel said he could not say how much earnings had risen in the September quarter.
Bleasel restated that the gas utility and energy group had a a earnings rise target of 10 percent.
AGL reported a 32 percent rise in net profit to A$124.3 million in 1995/96 to June 30.
